channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 欧洲人将气候变化评为世界第三大问题，仅次于粮食安全和武装冲突。他们为什么不投票给那些想在这方面有所作为的政党呢？ 👇
item.description:
Europeans rated climate change the third-most important problem in the world, behind food security and armed conflict. Why aren’t they voting for parties that want to do something about it? https://t.co/1FaSt0ShZ7 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 随着流媒体服务让观众对小银幕趋之若鹜，电影世界等连锁影院也进入了破产管理阶段。然而，最大的大银幕却在蓬勃发展：
item.description:
As streaming services keep audiences glued to the small screen, theatre chains such as Cineworld have entered administration. Yet the biggest of the big screens are thriving: https://t.co/MLe6Nq8Q6g pic.twitter.com/F7f3hh85JI

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 两本引人入胜的新回忆录探讨了多配偶制和离婚问题。作者们似乎在问同一个朴素的问题：这就是女性的进步吗？ 👇
item.description:
Two riveting new memoirs explore polyamory and divorce. The authors seem to be asking the same plaintive question: is this what progress looks like for women? https://t.co/x2GVN1qQSE 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 朝鲜世袭独裁者金正恩正在对韩国展开新一轮侵略。他最近的言论有几种趋势令人担忧
item.description:
Kim Jong Un, North Korea’s hereditary dictator, is embarking on a new round of aggression towards South Korea. Several trends make his recent rhetoric worrying https://t.co/3wRimLNPED

Image: AP pic.twitter.com/FmGayWLQqT

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 仓储式零售商好市多深受购物者和投资者的喜爱。在 "The Intelligence "节目中，我们的记者探讨了它是如何在库存产品少于竞争对手的情况下保持如此成功的。
item.description:
The warehouse retailer, Costco, is loved by shoppers and investors alike. On “The Intelligence” our correspondent explores how it manages to stay so successful despite stocking fewer products than its rivals https://t.co/K9Ahubr8yQ pic.twitter.com/vOZswqmcYr

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: "雄心勃勃 "是大多数分析师的评价。中国的 GDP 增长目标与 2023 年相同，为 "5% 左右"。这一扩张速度今年将更难实现👇。
item.description:
“Ambitious” is how most analysts are describing it. China’s GDP growth target is the same as 2023, at “around 5%”.

That pace of expansion will be harder to achieve this year https://t.co/P6ucR4qyyO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 想为《经济学人》报道财经新闻？了解如何申请 2024 年 Marjorie Deane 实习机会：
item.description:
Want to cover finance and economics for The Economist? Find out how to apply for the 2024 Marjorie Deane internship here: https://t.co/1n5xHFKcqs

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 西方正在输掉制裁战争吗？@alice_fulwood, @Birdyword 和 @TomLeeDevlin 在本周的 "Money Talks "播客中进行了调查： 👇
item.description:
Is the West losing its sanctions war? @alice_fulwood, @Birdyword and @TomLeeDevlin investigate on this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: https://t.co/y80LjTQXAe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 这十张图表比较了乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普的记录。谁更胜一筹？ 👇
item.description:
These ten charts compare Joe Biden’s record with Donald Trump’s. Who comes out better? https://t.co/J0vqmF9Esa 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 这些档案揭示了美国的一群外科医生、社会工作者和治疗师在如何为寻求性别确认护理的患者提供最佳服务方面所面临的困境 ⬇️
item.description:
The files reveal a group of surgeons, social workers and therapists in America struggling with how best to serve patients seeking gender-affirming care https://t.co/HENIb26veM ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）在加沙危机中的主要出路是争取停火和达成人质协议，最好是在斋月之前。Chantal Jahchan/Getty Images
item.description:
Joe Biden’s main way out of the crisis over Gaza is to work for a ceasefire and a hostage deal, ideally before Ramadan. But so far the president has declined to use America’s leverage more directly https://t.co/MQg7UfFI3D

Illustration: Chantal Jahchan/Getty Images pic.twitter.com/2njj7J4kxp

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 朝鲜正在武装俄罗斯，并威胁与韩国开战。金正恩误判的风险正在上升👇。
item.description:
North Korea is arming Russia and threatening war with South Korea.

The risks of miscalculation by Kim Jong Un are rising https://t.co/Hbcpj07Wlp 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 现在尼基-黑利退出了共和党竞选，唐纳德-特朗普将在没有对手的情况下参选。但在此之前，他已经在共和党内施展他的影响力 🇺🇸
item.description:
Now that Nikki Haley has dropped out of the Republican race, Donald Trump is running unopposed. But he was already flexing his influence over the Republican party before then https://t.co/YrVHcWNhfu 🇺🇸

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 超级星期二 "几乎已经确认，美国即将举行的总统大选将是 2020 年的重赛。在 "情报 "节目中，我们的华盛顿记者将探讨特朗普在共和党中的主导地位意味着什么。收听播客： 👇
item.description:
Super Tuesday has all but confirmed that America’s upcoming presidential election will be a rematch of 2020. On “The Intelligence” our Washington correspondent looks at what Trump’s dominance of the Republican Party means. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/WCtMLQyupM 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 法国已将堕胎作为一项宪法权利。该国立法者的压倒性投票是罕见的跨党派团结👇。
item.description:
France has made abortion a constitutional right. The overwhelming vote by the country’s legislators was a rare moment of cross-party unity https://t.co/huz8lIPncW 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 中国的政治比以往任何时候都更加不透明，但所传达的信息却是明确无误的：经济仍在失灵，权力正在集中，习近平坚定不移地专注于与美国的较量 Getty Images
item.description:
Chinese politics is more opaque than ever, but the message is unmistakable: the economy is still misfiring, power is concentrating and Xi Jinping is unwaveringly focused on the contest with America https://t.co/3f4r9jiAD8

Image: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/aEvixhTdXx

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 杰里米-亨特宣布将英国的国民保险费率削减两个百分点。他的预算案还打算终止有争议的针对外国富人的 "非家庭 "纳税地位👇。
item.description:
Jeremy Hunt has announced a cut in Britain’s rate of national insurance by two percentage points. His budget also intends to end to the controversial “non-dom” tax status for wealthy foreigners https://t.co/qmlDQY35JD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 纽约市面临的问题有多棘手？我们的 "制衡 "播客进行了调查。敬请收听 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 👇 。
item.description:
How intractable are the problems facing New York City? Our “Checks and Balance” podcast investigates. With @JohnPrideaux, @chowardchoward and @imkahloon https://t.co/ZAmdejBY4X 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 今天的 "情报"：超级星期二"、好市多的成功秘诀以及欧洲的卡莉-布莱德肖指数。收听每日播客 🎧
item.description:
Today on “The Intelligence”: Super Tuesday, Costco’s recipe for success, and a Carrie Bradshaw index for Europe. Listen to the daily podcast https://t.co/Gd4y5BMpeF 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 随着来自国外的挑战成倍增加，美国的精英大学正在浪费他们在国内的支持。为了保持竞争优势，常春藤联盟必须改变👇。
item.description:
As challenges from abroad multiply, America’s elite universities are squandering their support at home.

To keep their competitive edge the Ivy League will have to change https://t.co/t50uhhf7KF 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 有些人希望苹果公司能在 6 月份的年度开发者大会上宣布奇妙的人工智能升级，从而加入聊天机器人的热潮。但这并不是苹果公司的行事风格。也不应该是这样 👇
item.description:
Some hope that Apple will join the chatbot hypefest by announcing whizzy gen-AI upgrades at its annual developer conference in June. That, though, is not how the company does things. Nor should it be https://t.co/qKS80jFo8m 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在 "超级星期二 "获胜后，迅速成为全国共和党的主导👇。
item.description:
After his Super Tuesday wins, Donald Trump moves swiftly to dominate the national Republican Party https://t.co/Owk7M8yjoS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 对个人和组织来说，总是生气都不是好事。但总是非常满意也是如此。更平和的员工应该学会偶尔发发脾气👇。
item.description:
Being angry all the time is bad news for individuals and organisations alike. But so is always being tremendously satisfied. More equable workers should learn to let their tempers fly occasionally https://t.co/CjkYmeLtqe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 几起诉讼（其中一起由《纽约时报》提起）可能很快就会回答这个问题👇。
item.description:
Several lawsuits, one brought by the New York Times, could soon answer the question https://t.co/raEcbieTjn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 工作时间长，工资（相对而言）低，裁员过程残酷。人身暴力的威胁也潜伏其中。然而，人们仍然通过选举进入英国议会。为什么？
item.description:
The hours are long, the pay (relatively) bad and the redundancy process brutal. The threat of physical violence also lurks.

Yet people still get themselves elected to Britain’s Parliament. Why? https://t.co/52eXEUwhwb 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 法国人是合法堕胎权最坚定的支持者之一。法国投票将堕胎权定为一项宪法权利，这是向其他地方的妇女发出的支持信息：
item.description:
The French are among the strongest supporters of the legal right to abortion. The country’s vote to make it a constitutional right is a message of support to women elsewhere: https://t.co/O2Gp2IoT6h pic.twitter.com/r5A1JtG4zx

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 中层管理者常常被认为是懒惰的。事实上，他们有一个共同的问题👇。
item.description:
Middle managers are often presumed to be lazy. In fact, they are suffering from a common problem https://t.co/kH918sKcBY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 据报道，尼基-黑利（Nikki Haley）在 "超级星期二 "的共和党初选中仅赢得了一场胜利，即与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的对决，因此她计划暂停竞选活动。点击这里查看 👇
item.description:
Nikki Haley is reportedly planning to suspend her campaign after winning just one Republican primary—Vermont—against Donald Trump on Super Tuesday. Catch up here https://t.co/jBDsDVhOV2 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）近来对以色列的态度更加强硬，但他不会停止以色列的战争。面对国内外与日俱增的压力，这位美国总统将赌注押在了人质协议上👇。
item.description:
Joe Biden has sharpened his tone towards Israel of late, but will not stop its war. Facing mounting pressure at home and abroad, the American president is betting on a hostage deal https://t.co/p3Xx0P3d88 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024

item.title: 中国的统治者认为，他们对经济有着一致的愿景。但仔细一看，习近平的计划分崩离析👇。
item.description:
China’s rulers believe they have a coherent vision for the economy. But look closer and Xi Jinping’s plan falls apart https://t.co/FhkOCvMRj3 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 6, 2024
